dialogue.speaker: Princess LuLù
text: …What?
How?
Why?
Why did you come all this way?

dialogue.speaker: Link
text: Because you were in peril.

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuLù
text: I could have endured.
I would have carved my path to freedom.

dialogue.speaker: Link
text: I know. Yet the shadows grew deep.
Once sworn as the realm’s knight, I could not stand idle.

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuLù
text: You are not bound to that vow any longer.
My place is with the kingdom.
My people await me, my crown commands me.
You shall ever be welcome, but I cannot dwell at your side.
Why do you still come to me?

dialogue.speaker: Link
text: Because my spirit cannot turn away.
Because I dread the day our bond is remembered as dust and folly.
I dread the day our deeds are but hollow carvings, stripped of meaning.
I dread the day your gaze falls on all we wrought, and feels nothing.
And perhaps that day has already come…

dialogue.speaker: Princess LuLù
text: I have never sworn to forsake you.
You shielded me, and peace was restored.
But I can grant no more than this.
Why give so much for so little?

dialogue.speaker: Link
text: Because it is not little.
It is the sum of my strength, and the purest I have known.
Because I will not let it fade as though it were unworthy, or never was at all.
Because no oath could bind me as my heart has bound me to you.
This is not a bargain to be repaid. It is the keeping of what should not be lost.
